arts.ttl: O’Hare lands last blow on Bristol City as Sheffield United barrel into playoff final
arts.sum: For a side with such a horrendous record in the EFL playoffs, the way Sheffield United coasted through their semi-final’s two legs into the Championship’s showpiece game at Wembley did little to suggest they are a team with a hoodoo hanging over their heads. In many ways, history is stacked against the Blades: nine previous attempts at the playoffs, five semi-final defeats and four heartbreaking final losses. But if there was one crumb of comfort for manager Chris Wilder and his side in missing out on automatic promotion with a couple of games to spare, it was the fact that they had time to regather themselves and prepare for the playoffs. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Sheffield United 3-0 Bristol City (agg 6-0): Blades cruise into Championship play-off final
arts.sum: Coventry or Sunderland await in the Championship play-off final

arts.ttl: Sheffield United crush Bristol City and can now end 100 years of hurt at Wembley
arts.sum: SHEFFIELD UNITED 3-0 BRISTOL CITY (6-0): The Blades put the disappointment of missing out on automatic promotion behind them with a thumping win to secure a place in the Championship play-off final

arts.ttl: Blades seal play-off final spot with another comfortable win over Bristol City
arts.sum: The Blades won 3-0 at Bramall Lane for a 6-0 aggregate success.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United v Bristol City: Championship playoff semi-final, second leg – live
arts.sum: Championship playoffs, 8pm BST kick-off (first leg: 3-0) Read today’s Football Daily | And you can email John For Blades, Rhian Brewster and Tyrese Campbell are benched with Tom Cannon and Andre Brooks coming on. Callum O’Hare, who also got on the scoresheet at Ashton Gate and was influential in taking control of the tie, is back on the bench. For City, Liam Manning’s made four changes as he launches his Heeley Hail Mary at Bramall Lane. Scott Twine, Haydon Roberts, George Earthy and Cam Pring are starting, risks taken with Twine’s fitness. Rob Dickie is, of course, suspended. Continue reading...
